arts.ttl: Frank Lampard sums up Coventry City's outstanding victory against Sunderland in one word
arts.sum: A Haji Wright hat-trick put the fourth placed Black Cats to the sword in the best game and performance of the season so far from the Sky Blues, who moved back up to fifth place, having dropped down to seventh due to results on Friday night. Frank Lampard said his Coventry City side were a pleasure to watch after they blew away play-off rivals Sunderland in style at the CBS Arena.

arts.ttl: Wright hits treble as Coventry ease past Sunderland
arts.sum: Haji Wright scored a hat-trick as Coventry moved back into the play-off places with a 3-0 victory over fourth-placed Sunderland at the CBS Arena.

arts.ttl: Haji Wright hat-trick earns Coventry victory against Sunderland
arts.sum: The result moved the Sky Blues back into the play-off places.

arts.ttl: Coventry City player ratings with two 10s and a hat-trick as the Sky Blues batter Sunderland - Andy Turner
arts.sum: Bobby Thomas and Tasuhiro Sakamoto also went close in the opening 45 minutes against the Black Cats, and City continued to dominate and go in search of a third after the break when Thomas had a brilliant header from a corner denied by an equally impressive save from Anthony Patterson. Got forward nicely on the overlap to work in tandem with Tatsuhiro Sakamoto down the right wing and defended well throughout as City dominated at the CBS.

arts.ttl: Coventry City v Sunderland live updates and team news from the CBS Arena
arts.sum: Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group. Get the latest Coventry City headlines sent straight to your phone

arts.ttl: Frank Lampard on Coventry City’s big miss who’s even more popular with the fans
arts.sum: As for Rudoni joining the Sky Blue Army at Pride Park – a really nice touch that showed the connection between players and the fans, the City boss said: “Yeah, I love that. Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group.

arts.ttl: The story behind Coventry City's incredible pre-match anthem WLADITT
arts.sum: Coventry City’s now firmly established pre-match anthem ‘We’ll Live and Die in These Towns’ will be belted out with renewed gusto this afternoon when the Sky Blues take on Championship rivals Sunderland in one of the most eagerly anticipated fixtures on the calendar. The Enemy’s 2007 hit from the album of the same name has steadily become part of the pre kick-off ritual in recent seasons, providing the club with its very own identity from the Coventry band in the build-up to matches, serving to whip up the atmosphere from an expectant crowd and fire up the players.

arts.ttl: Sunderland Unveils Special Climate Change Awareness Crest on Kit
arts.sum: Sunderland AFC has revealed a special one-off kit modification for this weekend's match, featuring an altered version of its iconic coastal crest designed to highlight the devastating effects of climate change.

arts.ttl: Frank Lampard challenge as Coventry City go head-to-head with three of top four
arts.sum: Frank Lampard admits his Coventry City players need to a reset as they prepare to go head-to-head with Sunderland – the first of three games against teams battling it out for promotion in the top four of the Championship. “But we know with football that if we’re at our best, if we do the right things, if we are disciplined and have all the work ethics that we’ve brought in to this point then we’ll give ourselves a really good chance to compete in those games.

arts.ttl: Mason-Clark starts: Coventry City team news and predicted XI to face Sunderland
